subject: Science
title: How the Sun Drives Weather
description: A micro-lesson that makes How the Sun Drives Weather usable.

hook.text: All weather on Earth is powered by one thing: the Sun.

buildup.text: The equator gets more direct sunlight than the poles, creating a temperature imbalance.

discovery.text: That imbalance drives air circulation â€” warm air rises at the equator, cold air sinks at poles.

twist.text: Earth's rotation bends these air currents sideways, creating prevailing winds.

climax.text: This combination of heating and rotation creates every storm, breeze, and calm.

punchline.text: Weather is the atmosphere trying to balance the Sun's uneven heating.

quiz.question: What is the fundamental driver of all weather on Earth?
